page.title: 08FESTIVALS
page.content: Ellington Gala is held every year.A barbecue and fun-fair type amusements are set up,and novelty races.The funds raised are put towards village facilities.E.g. Swings and slides for the playing-field and money for the village club.A group of volunteers organise the gala.It has been going for approximately 40 years. It all started in the garden of a longstanding villager.It then expanded and moved to the village green.Another local festival is the Spaldwick flower festival.Flowers are aranged around the church and a painting competition is held.The church is open to the public and the festival is held in September.The festival may have originated from the St.James patron festival.
